metadata.title: CVE-2014-3684 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The tm_adopt function in lib/Libifl/tm.c in Terascale Open-Source Resourceand Queue Manager (aka TORQUE Resource Manager) 5.0.x, 4.5.x, 4.2.x, andearlier does not validate that the owner of the process also owns theadopted session id, which allows remote authenticated users to killarbitrary processes via a crafted executable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3684` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtorque2 - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.5
torque-client - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.5
torque-client-x11 - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.5
torque-common - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.5
torque-mom - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.5
torque-pam - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.5
torque-scheduler - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.5
torque-server - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: torque package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.16+dfsg-1.5').
